DataShape.description: Describes a frame composed of multiple bytes.
DataShape.name: FrameFormatDataShape

FieldDefinition.description: What is the last bit in the field. This is inclusive, so it's included in the frame
FieldDefinition.name: bitEnd

FieldDefinition.description: What is the first bit in the field. This is inclusive, so it's included in the frame
FieldDefinition.name: bitStart

FieldDefinition.description: Name of the field. Will be used in the result
FieldDefinition.name: fieldName

FieldDefinition.description: This automatically assumes that we are going to use 32 bits from the bit start value
FieldDefinition.name: isFloat32

FieldDefinition.description: If a frame spans multiple bytes, how are the bytes organized
FieldDefinition.name: isLittleEndian

FieldDefinition.description: Should a 32 bit value be treated as unsigned or not
FieldDefinition.name: isUnsigned

FieldDefinition.description: The value of this frame. Used when encoding frames
FieldDefinition.name: value
